verses.text_plain: Then Job answered the Lord, and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then Job answered the Lord, and said,

verses.text_plain: I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.
verses.verse_html:
2I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee. ▼
▼ no thought can be…: or, no thought of thine can be hindered

footnotes.body_text: ▼ no thought can be…: or, no thought of thine can be hindered
footnotes.body_html: ▼ no thought can be…: or, no thought of thine can be hindered

verses.text_plain: Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
verses.verse_html: 3Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.

verses.text_plain: Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.verse_html: 4Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

tokens.text: I beseech thee, and I will speak

verses.text_plain: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
verses.verse_html: 5I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
verses.verse_html: 6Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

verses.text_plain: And it was so, that after the Lord had spoken these words unto Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
verses.verse_html: 7And it was so, that after the Lord had spoken these words unto Job, the Lord said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.

tokens.text: against thee, and against thy two

verses.text_plain: Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.
verses.verse_html:
8Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job. ▼
▼ him: Heb. his face, or, person

tokens.text: in that ye have not spoken

footnotes.body_text: ▼ him: Heb. his face, or, person
footnotes.body_html: ▼ him: Heb. his face, or, person

verses.text_plain: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the Lord commanded them: the Lord also accepted Job.
verses.verse_html:
9So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the Lord commanded them: the Lord also accepted Job. ▼
▼ Job: Heb. the face of Job

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Job: Heb. the face of Job
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Job: Heb. the face of Job

verses.text_plain: And the Lord turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.verse_html:
10And the Lord turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before. ▼
▼ gave…: Heb. added all that had been to Job unto the double

footnotes.body_text: ▼ gave…: Heb. added all that had been to Job unto the double
footnotes.body_html: ▼ gave…: Heb. added all that had been to Job unto the double

verses.text_plain: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the Lord had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.
verses.verse_html: 11Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the Lord had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.

tokens.text: there unto him all his brethren
and all they that had been of his acquaintance

verses.text_plain: So the Lord blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.
verses.verse_html: 12So the Lord blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.

verses.text_plain: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
verses.verse_html: 13He had also seven sons and three daughters.

verses.text_plain: And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Keren–happuch.
verses.verse_html: 14And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Keren–happuch.

verses.text_plain: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
verses.verse_html: 15And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

verses.text_plain: After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons’ sons, even four generations.
verses.verse_html: 16After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons’ sons, even four generations.

verses.text_plain: So Job died, being old and full of days.
verses.verse_html: 17So Job died, being old and full of days.
